news_header: Daily small packages are shipped from China to Finland, with customs conducting random inspections.
news_original_title: Temu räjäytti vuodessa pakettirallin – tässä lista suomalaisten tilaamasta krääsästä
news_text: The volume of small packages from Chinese online shops to Finland has surged, with customs reporting 28.2 million consignments last year, a 35-fold increase over two years. The majority of these packages come from platforms like Temu, Shein, and Aliexpress, primarily ordered by private consumers. Customs Director Olli-Pekka Penttilä noted a significant rise in imitation jewelry imports and expressed concerns about product safety, advocating for stricter regulations on direct imports from third countries. Many packages pass through customs without inspection, raising risks for consumers regarding harmful products.
